docs.title: Development
docs.text:
This documentation is to help you contribute to the project.

For backend development, checkout this documentation.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
1. Install Devenv on your system.
  2. Ensure you have a compatible package manager (e.g., nix).

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
1. Clone the repository:

    bash git clone https://github.com/4t-24/4ctf cd 4ctf

  2. Start the development environment:

    bash devenv up

  3. Open a development shell:

    bash devenv shell

docs.title: Installed Packages
docs.text:
• git for version control.
  • go for backend development.
  • golangci-lint for linting Go code.

docs.title: Installed Tools
docs.text: • air: A live-reloading tool for Go development, installed automatically during setup.

docs.title: Development Shell
docs.text: You can enter the development shell by using : devenv shell. This allows you to have all the necessary tools to develop properly.
